Posts.Content: May 18, 2017 07:49PM Patersongirl wrote: I had my imaging on Monday and physical today with my doctor. The left breast which I thought had a large mass and I was having discharge from the nipple has 6 cysts in it. The right breast, which I thought was my good breast, has 5 more cysts in it and 2 nodules. The doctor said it could be a fibroadenoma but would need to be biopsied. But he told me there was one nodule but my doctor read the report and it says 2 nodules. Not sure what happened why there is a discrepancy between the report and what he told me. I have to go in for a core biopsy next week on the largest nodule. My doctor does not understand why they don't want to biopsy both nodules. I do not have a copy of the report - when I do I will come back with the specifics. Since there is 2 nodules, is that more likely an adenoma. i think I read somewhere that multiples are not inclined to be BC. I do want to thank everyone who replied and helped me though this. Friends that I have talked to just don't understand and thought I was panicking unnecessarily. I am alone and this was very overwhelming for me.

Posts.Content: May 8, 2017 12:18AM Patersongirl wrote: Thank Icietla for your reply. I am glad I found this site as it has helped me learn more about what I may or may not have. My appointment is on Thursday but I am going to call tomorrow morning and see if they have an openings/cancellations to let me know. I am single at this point in time but I have two good friends that are listening to me go through this and have been supportive, I just cant believe how quickly this lump appeared. I just thought it was a cyst as I had before and I became complacent in this assumption. I had no idea it would get worse and possibly something more. I regret not being more pro-active . I wish I had a second chance
